Build¶

The Akson underlying code is currently hosted on GitHub on a public repository that allows many types of action. | With the potentialities of the open-source world, and the command line interfaces everyone can clone, fork and mess with the Akson code. HEre are some instructions to be able to do that.

Instructions¶

Instructions to build the system in MacOS

  • Open the terminal
  • Change the current working directory to the location where you want the cloned directory to be made. | In MacOS the commands will be ls to see what there is in your directory and cd new_directory to change folder. Most probably the terminal will open the user in :~ username$.
  • You will also need to have git installed. When the terminal is opened type:
$ git --version
$ cd Desktop
$ git clone https://github.com/luisArandas/akson

After that if you don’t have git installed a window will prompt to install

Cloning into 'akson'...
remote: Enumerating objects: 110, done.
remote: Counting objects: 100% (110/110), done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (69/69), done.
remote: Total 6001 (delta 65), reused 81 (delta 41), pack-reused 5891
Receiving objects: 100% (6001/6001), 21.03 MiB | 5.71 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (1583/1583), done.

$ cd akson
$ npm install
Some stuff 
Install xpress, nodejs, socketio and all other things => npm


https://help.github.com/en/articles/fork-a-repo


def some_function():
    interesting = False
    print 'This line is highlighted.'
    print 'This one is not...'
    print '...but this one is.'
